page.title: 15ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: The{Adam Smith Centre}was built in {1899}and began life as a Victorian concert hall.In 1973 it was renovated and turned into a modern theatre. On average 350 tickets are sold each day ,Monday to Friday , but on Saturday nights the auditorium's 475 seats are filled. Although many types of shows are performed on the stage the most popular seems to be the{pantomime. Sunday evenings are also very popular when the Theatre is used to show {films. Mr. Potter ,the Theatre Director, is in charge of 11 full time and several part time staff. Theatre performers are very {superstitious}and they believe it is unlucky to whistle in the dressing room. If anyone does this they must go outside and turn round three times.
